UNIVERSITY OF MICHIGAN
WALDO ABBOT, DIRECTOR OF BROADCASTING
ANN ARBOR. MICH.
October 17, 1955
E. G. BURROWS. PROGRAM DIRECTOR
Mr* John Holt
NAEB Tape Manager
Gregory Hall
Urban a, Illinois
Dear John:
am
OCTltK&j
l Tm not supposed to vote upon the various sub¬
missions but it seems to me there are quite a number that
donft have an adequate vote upon them at the present time.
So, I’ll take the liberty of putting in a few votes which
may settle up some of these programs*
I would vote in favor of the WINDOW IN THE
WORLD. In favor of the COOPER UNION series. In favor of
the TALES OF THE VALIANT neces s a ri Iy * In favor of the
WORLD OF ATOMIC ENERGY. fn favor of the UNESCO gift.
According to my records most of these have
but one vote, so it may help to get a second vote in, although
I think it is up to the committee to really decide and not
to me. According to my records there are still about 20
programs which are still hanging in the air, although it may
be that I don’t get the votes that are cast upon all of these.
So if the favorable votes are of any value go ahead and use
them.
See you in Chicago.
Cordial Iy you rs,
CtLtZjJlo
Waldo Abbot
Director of Broadcasting
